chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status Conference on December 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADA Micabil Diaz appeared in person for State. Defendant Nicholas Locklear appeared in person w/Atty William Flottmeyer. Case tracking with 22CF165.  PTC set for 11-14-2022 at 10:00 a.m. STC set for 12-15-2022 at 1:30 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing
Attorney Flottmeyer advised defendant waives reading of information and stands mute. Tracking Trempealeau County Case No 22CF165. STC set. Bond cont.

3:00 PM Defendant Nicholas Adrian Locklear in court.  Attorney William P Flottmeyer in court for Nicholas Adrian Locklear.  Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def wishes to waive right to PH. Court advised def right to PH. Def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for further proceedings. Information filed. Atty Flottmery states def waives reading of information and stands mute. Court enters NG plea. Track with Trempealeau County Case No. 22CF165. STC set. Bond to continue.
